messages.subject: Re: math / puzzle books
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks everyone for your suggestions! I am emailing the link to Puzzlemania to my mom to look over - and if she doesn t decide to get it for my son, I may just
messages.messageBody:
Thanks everyone for your suggestions! I am emailing the link to Puzzlemania to my mom to look over - and if she doesn't decide to get it for my son, I may just order it myself! :-)

...Lizz in Iowa

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] math / puzzle books
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/15/01 3:41:59 PM, cnlcuroe@bel-net.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/15/01 3:41:59 PM, cnlcuroe@... writes:

<< Puzzlemania - has anyone ever
heard of this as a subscription, and if so, do you have any links or a ph#
where I can get more info?

Or do you have any other magazine suggestions for a 7yo boy? >>

Games magazine has some stuff that's not too hard for seven, and if he saved
the back issues he could eventually get to all of it.

I thought Puzzlemania was put out by Highlites (but I could be wrong--I only
get them at thrift stores <g>).

My favorite is World, by National Geographic, but my kids haven't warmed up
to it themselves. I should just subscribe for me and leave it lying
around...

I'd just go to google.com and enter "puzzlemania" and "subscription" and if
that doesn't do you, try "back issues."

Sandra

"Everything counts."
http://expage.com/SandraDoddArticles
http://expage.com/SandraDodd

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] math / puzzle books

Puzzlemania is great. There is also a Mathmania.

Both published by Highlights -- I think-- at least Puzzlemania is.

Nance

messages.subject: math / puzzle books
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all, My son has been receiving Highlites magazine (gift sub from my mom) but has decided that he d rather get something like Puzzlemania - has anyone ever
messages.messageBody:
Hi all,

My son has been receiving Highlites magazine (gift sub from my mom) but has
decided that he'd rather get something like Puzzlemania - has anyone ever
heard of this as a subscription, and if so, do you have any links or a ph#
where I can get more info?

Or do you have any other magazine suggestions for a 7yo boy?

Thanks!

...Lizz in Iowa
